conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a death movie. Could you recommend a few?

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM

I'd highly recommend you watch "Capote" (2005). This gripping film follows author Truman Capote as he delves deep into a real-life murder case, forming an unusual bond with one of the killers on death row. Starring Philip Seymour Hoffman in a powerful performance, it's a thought-provoking exploration of morality and justice.

If you're looking for something more action-packed, "The Purge: Election Year" (2016) might be up your alley. It follows a presidential candidate targeted during the annual Purge night and the former police sergeant who steps in to protect her. A thrilling tale of survival against all odds!

If you're still curious about 'Truman', it's a poignant and emotional story about friendship and loyalty featuring memorable performances by James Gammon and Tony Goldwyn. Enjoy the films!
